hackathon-description-text: HackHERS is a hackathon organized by Rutgers University's Women in Computer Science, along with The Douglass Project. We want to create a space in which women of different backgrounds and academic disciplines can come together and be empowered to create. At this hackathon, women (and men) will get involved in learning, planning, and developing apps that will foster growth and productivity among women who want to code.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: HackHERS is proud to support and encourage diversity and inclusivity in tech. Because of this, there must be at least one woman on the team in order to be considered for the 1st place prize. The 2nd and 3rd place prizes have no restrictions.

We love seeing women empowering other women through technology! Whether it’s for equality in the workplace, women’s health, or anything else you can think of, this prize category is for women helping each other <3
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best App for Women by Women

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Hackathons aren’t all work and no play. This prize is for the inner class clown in you! Win something silly to take home by making us laugh until we fall :)
Everyone has to start somewhere! For all the people who came here just starting to code, we encourage you to keep building things and learning. This is just the start of a truly rewarding journey.
A hack that's just plain awesome.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=59 Biel Rd, New Brunswick, NJ 08901, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Technicality, creativity, interest, wow factor, and more!

hackathon-location-address: 59 Biel Rd, New Brunswick, NJ 08901, USA
hackathon-description-header: We are a women-focused hackathon, where we provide a comfortable environment for women to hack alongside men.
